channel.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
channel.description:
Well, I was thinking, I am not so awesome at java, I know the basic things, booleans, ints, methods, blah blah...but I was wondering...is making a new java file worth it? And would it help me get better at Java? :P
Such as, in my client.java, thats how my potions work, because the codes are in client.java. Would it be worth the time to make a potionHandler instead of keeping the code in client.java? I know how to make it, just wondering if it would make it any better/cleaner?
Kind of a dumb question, but oh well.

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

It’s the fact it uses terrible I/O design, multi-threading, poor packet processing, the use of ‘process()’, etc.

Using correct Object Orientated Programming is always good, no matter the situation.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

It not only the fact that it never drops packets, or the way it handles incoming ones, I fixed those and I still have lag when there shouldnt be, and no, its not my Public Boolean Process

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.description:
@Trigger1 wrote:

That is not the reason why wL lags.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

What are you disagreeing with? The lag part? From everything that I’ve been told, this is one of the reasons non-wL server hail over all, because they don’t use a gigantic client.java

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @Trigger1 Trigger*
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

separating your client.java out into “handlers” should reduce craploads of lag. Problem is separating them and having them still work.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It wouldn’t help that much. One of the reasons that most servers based off of WinterLove’s work are inefficient is because of the creation of the huge client instance when a new person logs in.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?

item.title: Is making a new java file really worth it?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Theres no such thing as a ‘handler’,
But making a separate file to store your source code would be wise.

Read full topic
item.source: Is making a new java file really worth it?
